head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Queens: 3 Accused Of Defacing Tunnel

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Manufacturing, Operations and Logistics

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Queens: 3 Accused Of Defacing Tunnel

abstract.p: Three Brooklyn men are charged with criminal mischief, making grafitti and causing more than $10,000 in damage by spray-painting subway tunnel (S)

block.p: Three Brooklyn men have been indicted on charges of causing more than $10,000 in damage by spray-painting a subway tunnel on the L line, prosecutors said yesterday. The three -- Miles Wickham, 22, of Fifth Street; Michael Baca, 22, of Meeker Avenue; and Raul Mendez, of East New York Avenue -- are charged with multiple counts of criminal mischief and making graffiti, said Richard A. Brown, the Queens district attorney. Mr. Brown said the men videotaped themselves spraying their graffiti tags and the slogan ''ACC'' on tunnel walls between the Halsey Street and Wilson Avenue stations. He said ACC stood for All City Crew or Another Crime Committed.

Brown, the Queens district attorney. Mr. Brown said the men videotaped themselves spraying their graffiti tags and the slogan ''ACC'' on tunnel walls between the Halsey Street and Wilson Avenue stations. He said ACC stood for All City Crew or Another Crime Committed.
